definition: to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: They rarely push the government's limits.
sentences.chinese: 他们很少触及政府的戒条。

sentences.english: This is the great and first commandment.
sentences.chinese: 这是最伟大和最首要的戒条。

sentences.english: As guidelines for virtue and ethical behavior, the Buddha formulated precepts for us to follow.
sentences.chinese: 佛陀制定了戒条作为我们道德行为的指导方针。

definition: to go against the rules (of a religious order)/to break a ban (e.g. medical)
lit. compass and set square/fig. established standard/rule/customs/practices/fig. upright and honest/well-behaved
to abstain from/to prohibit (certain foods etc)
